title: Russia-aligned hackers abuse Viber to deliver malware to Ukrainian targets
executive_summary: A Russia-aligned cyber espionage group has been observed using the Viber messaging platform to distribute malicious files to Ukrainian military and government organizations.
The campaign shifts malware delivery from email to instant messaging to increase success and evade traditional security controls.
what_happened: Attackers sent malicious ZIP archives over Viber containing Windows shortcut (LNK) files disguised as Microsoft Word and Excel documents.
When opened, these shortcut files executed PowerShell commands that downloaded additional malware from attacker-controlled servers.
The malware chain deployed a loader that ran in memory and ultimately installed a remote access trojan, allowing attackers to control infected systems.
who_is_affected: Government departments and public sector organizations
Individuals receiving unsolicited files via messaging platforms
attack_flow: Malicious ZIP archive sent via Viber message
Malware executes in memory and establishes remote access
business_impact: Potential theft of confidential or strategic information
Increased risk of espionage and follow-on attacks
risk_reason: Using a trusted messaging platform as a delivery mechanism allows attackers to bypass email security controls and exploit user trust, making detection and prevention more difficult.
what_usually_goes_wrong: Users trust files received through familiar messaging apps
Shortcut files are mistaken for legitimate documents
Messaging traffic is not monitored as closely as email

immediate: Warn users not to open unsolicited archives or files received via messaging apps
Restrict execution of shortcut files on endpoints
short_term: Monitor systems for suspicious PowerShell activity
Inspect outbound traffic for unexpected downloads
long_term: Include messaging platforms in security awareness training
Extend endpoint monitoring to detect in-memory malware execution

signs: Unknown scheduled tasks or startup entries
alerts: Detection of remote access tools on endpoints
Inbound archives received through messaging applications
